summary: "Peanuts," a famous American comic strip by Charles M. Schulz, ran from 1950 to 2000. It features young kids, like Charlie Brown, who is shy and often unlucky. The strip is known for its clever humor and deep thoughts. At the time of Schulz's death, it was in over 2,600 newspapers worldwide. "Peanuts" was so popular it was made into a movie in 2015. Schulz drew every detail of the strip himself for nearly 50 years.
title: Peanuts
